data.title: How was Spider-Man: Unlimited supposed to end?
data.meta_description:
Now then

Everyone who managed to get into the show will know the show ended on a cliffhanger. Anyway, despite it's screwy premisis, I don't think the...
data.text:
Now then

Everyone who managed to get into the show will know the show ended on a cliffhanger. Anyway, despite it's screwy premisis, I don't think the producers where stupid enough to have it all end on a cliffhanger (after all, one of them was Micheal Reeves of Batman [and Gargoyles?] fame!). What I've never quite gathered is, what was supposed to happen in season 2? What happened to the synombtic (spelling?).

Was he ever supposed to get back to MJ on earth?

Ive been interested in this myself. I know Spider-Man Unlimited wasnt very popular, but im still curious how it was supposed to end, or at the very least how they were gonna solve the cliffhanger. I once remember reading they actually did write up a script for the season 2 premier, does anybody know if it ever showed up on the internet?

BlackoutCreature said:

Ive been interested in this myself. I know Spider-Man Unlimited wasnt very popular, but im still curious how it was supposed to end, or at the very least how they were gonna solve the cliffhanger. I once remember reading they actually did write up a script for the season 2 premier, does anybody know if it ever showed up on the internet?

As I recall, Larry Brody said that Peter was supposed to return home on the last episode of season 2, and then they were going to go back to "regular" episodes to coincide with the release of the movie.

DRG4 said:

As I recall, Larry Brody said that Peter was supposed to return home on the last episode of season 2,

I remember reading that in Spider-Man Confidential: From Comic Icon to Hollywood Hero (probably still available at Barnes and Noble).

and then they were going to go back to "regular" episodes to coincide with the release of the movie.

Wow...really? Awesome. They really had something going for the series with the opening sequence of the pilot episode--until Spidey was thrown out of his element by sending him to Counter Earth. The writers would have made a wonderful sequel to Spidey:TAS.
